title: Tech Sector Job Displacement by 2030
description: Projected percentage of current tech sector jobs that will be automated or significantly restructured by AI by 2030. Only data points where sources directly state a displacement figure are plotted.

overlays.label: Challenger: 78K tech jobs lost to AI in H1 2025
BLS: SW dev growth revised down from 25% to 17%
Dallas Fed: young worker share fell 0.9pp
CompTIA: IT unemployment rose from 3.9% to 5.7%
METR (updated): AI made experienced open-source devs 18% slower (CI: -38% to +9%)
Microsoft/Accenture: 26% more pull requests with Copilot
Cognizant: computer/math roles 67% task exposure — second highest of all categories
Goldman (Mei): AI impact 'largely confined to tech sector'; expects it to grow materially

sources.title: The economic potential of generative AI
sources.excerpt: Generative AI could enable automation of up to 70% of business activities across occupations.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2023
sources.excerpt: Employers estimate that 44% of workers' core skills will be disrupted in the next five years.

sources.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
sources.excerpt: AI will increase productivity but impact on jobs more modest than often claimed; estimates ~5% of tasks fully automatable.

sources.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
sources.excerpt: AI could expose 300 million full-time jobs globally to automation.

sources.title: New data show no AI jobs apocalypse — for now
sources.excerpt: Current employment data do not yet show large-scale AI-driven displacement.

sources.title: Beyond AI Exposure: Which Tasks are Cost-Effective to Automate with Computer Vision?
sources.excerpt: Only 23% of worker wages for vision tasks would be cost-effective to automate with AI today.

sources.title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
OECD Employment Outlook 2025: AI and the Labour Market
Alphabet Inc. 2024 10-K — Workforce & AI Automation Disclosures
sources.excerpt: Alphabet disclosed ongoing workforce restructuring, noting AI tools have reduced need for certain engineering and support roles while increasing demand for AI/ML specialists.

sources.title: Meta Platforms 2024 10-K — AI Efficiency & Headcount
sources.excerpt: Meta's 'Year of Efficiency' resulted in ~21,000 job cuts across 2023. Company cited AI-driven productivity gains enabling smaller teams to maintain output.

sources.title: Tech Sector Job Postings Analysis Q4 2024
sources.excerpt: Software developer postings declined 14% YoY while AI/ML engineer postings grew 45%. Net tech postings down 6% reflecting structural shift, not just cyclical downturn.

sources.title: 78,000 Tech Jobs Lost to AI in H1 2025
sources.excerpt: 78,000 tech sector job losses attributed to AI in the first half of 2025, with QA testing, junior development, and IT support roles most affected.

sources.title: BLS Revised Tech Sector Employment Projections 2024-2034
sources.excerpt: BLS projects AI will dampen software developer employment growth to 17% through 2034, revised down from prior 25% estimate, as AI coding tools reduce headcount needs.

sources.title: Canaries in the Coal Mine? Six Facts about the Recent Employment Effects of AI
sources.publisher: Stanford Digital Economy Lab (Brynjolfsson, Chandar, Chen)
sources.excerpt: 13% relative decline in employment for workers ages 22-25 in most AI-exposed occupations. Software developer employment for ages 22-25 down nearly 20% since ChatGPT's launch.

sources.title: Displacement or Complementarity? The Labor Market Impact of Generative AI
sources.excerpt: 17% decrease in job postings for occupations in top quartile of automation potential, alongside 22% increase in postings for augmentation-prone occupations.

sources.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Economic Primitives
sources.excerpt: Computer/mathematical tasks account for ~33% of all Claude.ai conversations and ~50% of API traffic, indicating concentrated AI impact on tech-adjacent roles.

sources.title: Young workers' employment drops in occupations with high AI exposure
sources.excerpt: Employment share of young workers (20-24) in most AI-exposed occupations fell from 16.4% to 15.5% between November 2022 and September 2025.

sources.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
sources.excerpt: Young tech workers (20-30) unemployment risen ~3pp since start of 2025; tech employment share fallen below pre-pandemic trend.

sources.title: AI's Impact on Job Growth
sources.excerpt: Tech/info/media employment stopped growing at end of 2022, coinciding with ChatGPT release; less than 10% of firms using AI regularly as of mid-2025.

sources.title: Indeed Hiring Lab: Software Developer Job Postings Tracker
sources.excerpt: Software developer job postings declined 33% from pre-ChatGPT levels. Overall tech postings down 36%. AI/ML roles the only growing category.

sources.title: BLS Occupational Employment Statistics: Computer Programmers — Observed Decline
sources.excerpt: Computer programmer employment (routine coding roles) fell ~27.5% in roughly two years following ChatGPT's release — one of the largest two-year drops in any occupation tracked by BLS. Software developer employment remained flat.

sources.title: BLS Employment Projections: Computer Programmers 2024–2034
sources.excerpt: BLS projects a further 6% decline in programmer roles through 2034. Computer programmer employment (routine coding roles) fell ~27.5% in roughly two years following ChatGPT's release — one of the largest two-year drops in any occupation tracked by BLS. Software developer employment remained flat.

sources.title: 2025 Year-End Challenger Report: AI-Related Job Cuts
sources.excerpt: 54,694 job cuts cited AI as a reason in 2025, concentrated in tech, finance, and customer service sectors.

sources.title: CompTIA Tech Jobs Report: IT Unemployment Trends
sources.excerpt: IT unemployment rate rose from 3.9% to 5.7% between late 2024 and mid-2025, the highest level since 2021, driven by AI-related restructuring.

sources.title: Uplift Update: Measuring AI's Impact on Open-Source Developer Productivity
sources.excerpt: Updated study: original developers now estimated at -18% speedup (CI: -38% to +9%). Newly-recruited developers estimated at -4% (CI: -15% to +9%). Wide confidence intervals span zero.

sources.title: The Effects of Generative AI on Computing Workers' Productivity
sources.publisher: Microsoft/Accenture (Cui, Demirer, Jaffe, Musolff, Peng, Salz)
sources.excerpt: 26% increase in completed pull requests, 13.55% increase in commits, 38.38% increase in builds — but build success rate fell by 5.53 percentage points.

sources.title: The Impact of AI on Developer Productivity: Evidence from GitHub Copilot
sources.excerpt: RCT: developers completed a coding task 55.8% faster with GitHub Copilot assistance.

sources.title: New Work, New World 2026: How AI is Reshaping Work
sources.excerpt: Computer and mathematical roles have 67% task exposure to AI — second only to financial managers (84%). Analysis of 18,000 tasks across 1,000 O*NET occupations. Exposure scores are 30% above what was originally projected for 2032.

sources.title: AI and the US Labor Market: Current Impact and Outlook
sources.excerpt: AI's labor market impact has so far been 'largely confined to the technology sector itself, where employment trends have weakened materially in the last three years.' Expects impact to grow materially. Net positive hiring impulse from AI-infrastructure builders and AI-proficient workers partially offsets losses.
